item.title: Bill Ackman slams Biden-Harris on hostage crisis: 'Consider his parents spoke at DNC...'
item.description: Bill Ackman, a hedge fund billionaire, criticized the Biden-Harris administration after six hostages, including one American, were found dead in Gaza. Ackman condemned the US strategy of pressuring Israel for a ceasefire rather than regional allies. Biden expressed outrage and vowed retribution against Hamas, while Harris emphasized the need to eliminate Hamas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Princess Diana's family wants Harry and William to reconcile: 'If anyone can....'
item.description: As the Spencers are working hard to get the brothers to reconcile, one insider told the Daily Beast both Harry and William adore Princess Diana's elder sister Jane, Robert's widow. They could not decline to attend the funeral out of their respect for Jane and if anyone mediate between the two, it will be Jane.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tim Walz walks away when asked to comment on dead hostages found in Gaza
item.description: Former president Donald Trump doubled down on the Biden-Harris administration after the hostages were found dead. In a Truth Social post, Trump blamed Kamala Harris and President Joe Biden for the hostage crisis and reiterated that had he been the president, the October 7 attack would have never happened. ​Six bodies were found in Rafah, the southern Gaza hub including that of Hersh Goldberg-Polin who was an American citizen. The Israeli military said the hostages have been brutally murdered by Hamas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tim Walz's brother 'sounds like a really great guy' to Donald Trump. Who is Jeff Walz?
item.description: Jeff Walz, elder brother of Democratic VP candidate Tim Walz, has publicly opposed Tim's political stance and is considering endorsing Donald Trump. Jeff, a long-time Republican, said Tim is not the person who should decide America's future. The brothers have not spoken in eight years and Jeff said Tim did not inform him that he was running for the vice president.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former Clinton official says Elon Musk is out of control: 'He should be threatened'
item.description: Robert Reich, a former US labor secretary, calls for regulating Elon Musk's influence in his Guardian article. He suggests measures like boycotting Tesla and threatening legal action against Musk, citing allegations of foreign interference on X, Musk's platform. Reich's concerns align with Musk expressing interest in a future Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ella Emhoff says she can't continue her knit club. It has something to do with Kamala Harris
item.description: In July, there was a security breach incident involving Ella Emhoff and a man who caused damage to vehicles belonging to two of Ella's protective details was arrested. Ella was inside a restaurant when the man damaged the cars waiting outside. Ella was escorted out of the restaurant and removed from the site. The incident took place close on the heels of the assassination attempt on Donald Trump for which the Secret Service came under fire.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Tulsi Gabbard revealed who actually runs the US govt: 'Neither Biden, nor Kamala...'
item.description: Tulsi Gabbard said the number of politicians who want to continue war is shocking. "They won't say I like war or I like to see more people dead, of course. They won't use those words but politicians with donors from defence companies want war," Tulsi Gabbard said. "It's like we are going to punish this bad guy, topple this regime...without thinking through the implications," Tulsi said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 1 dead, several injured in Pittsburgh shooting, day after attack inside university
item.description: A shooting incident took place near a Speedway gas station in the suburbs of Pittsburg killing one and injuring several others. Multiple people were shot near the Speedway located on State Street in Clairton, southeast of Pittsburgh, police said. Three victims with gunshot wounds were found in the street. One man was transported to an area hospital in grave condition. He was pronounced deceased at the hospital, according to a report from Pittsburgh Public Safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Anger grows in Israel after Hamas kills 6 hostages; Netanyahu vows to 'settle score'
item.description: Israeli soldiers discovered the bodies of six hostages in a Gaza underground tunnel, brutally murdered by Hamas shortly before recovery. With 101 hostages still in Gaza, Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed retaliation. Amid rising violence in the West Bank, public pressure and protests mount in Israel for swift governmental action to secure the hostages' release.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Canada’s legalised marijuana sector is facing a sobering time
item.description: Canada may serve as a case study—good or bad—for other countries considering federal cannabis legalization. A Statistics Canada study from April revealed that over two-thirds of Canadian consumers who used cannabis in the past year purchased it legally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In alarming sign, US military veterans split publicly over support for Donald Trump
item.description: A political division has emerged among military families after Donald Trump's visit to Arlington National Cemetery. Criticized for politicizing a solemn event, Trump defended his actions with supportive family videos. Vice President Kamala Harris condemned Trump, adding to the debate on who should be accountable for the Afghanistan debacle and what defines patriotism.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Melania asks husband to not use foul language like 's**t'. Donald Trump's reply is...
item.description: Donald Trump revealed his wife, Melania Trump, often urges him not to use foul language during his speeches. Evangelical leader Franklin Graham also advised him similarly. However, Trump finds it hard to substitute certain words. In Pennsylvania on Friday, Trump asked how should he frame a sentence like 'Everything she (Kamala Harris) touches turns to s**t'. “Every place she touches wouldn’t be nice?" Trump said explaining why he can't substitute some foul expressions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Kamala Harris looking more presidential. She lifts her chin...': Expression expert decodes CNN interview
item.description: Kamala Harris, recently nominated as the Democratic presidential candidate, gave her first CNN interview. While microexpressions expert Annie Särnblad saw her as increasingly presidential, body language experts like Susan Constantine and Greg Hartley criticised her for a lack of confidence and internal struggle that dominated her during the interview.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Your administration killed my son': Gold Star families blast Kamala Harris amid politics over Arlington row
item.description: In reply to Kamala Harris' dig, Donald Trump posted a series of videos from Gold Star parents who blamed Harris administration for the death of the soldiers. “I am Steve Nikoui, I am the father of Lance Corporal Kareem M. Nikoui. Your administration killed my son, deliberately in exchange for political theatrics so you could have a final day of the evacuation coinciding with September 11th," Nikoui said in a video.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Remembering Hersh Goldberg-Polin: Soccer-loving Hamas hostage who braved live grenades
item.description: Described by his mother, Rachel Goldberg-Polin, as a “happy-go-lucky, laid back, good-humoured, respectful, and curious person,” Hersh was an elder brother to two sisters and deeply passionate about soccer, music, and travel. His childhood fascination with geography led him to collect atlases, globes, maps, and stacks of National Geographic magazines, filling his bedroom with symbols of his curiosity about the world. “He has been obsessed with geography and travel since he was a little boy,” Rachel said in a heartfelt speech at the Democratic National Convention (DNC).
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vladimir Putin gifts purebred horses to Kim Jong-Un after arms support for Ukraine war
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin gifts 24 Orlov Trotters to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, reflecting a deepening alliance. Reports indicate the horses are part of payment for artillery shells from North Korea aiding Russia's military efforts in Ukraine. This event underscores their growing military cooperation and significant geopolitical implications.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UN and Palestinian authorities launches massive polio vaccination campaign in war-torn Gaza
item.description: Palestinian health authorities and UN agencies have initiated an extensive polio vaccination campaign in Gaza, aiming to vaccinate about 640,000 children. The drive faces significant challenges due to ongoing conflict, destruction, and displacement. The initiative underscores the urgent need for a temporary truce to allow families to safely access health facilities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Melania hates Donald, prefers Kamala Harris', claims Trump ex-aide
item.description: Anthony Scaramucci, a former Trump aide, said on the MediasTouch podcast that Melania Trump would prefer Kamala Harris to win the upcoming election, alleging that she hates her husband, Donald Trump. He used this assertion as a measure of Trump's unpopularity. Though maintaining a low profile since January 2021, sources claim Melania supports Trump's re-election campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine drones target refinery, power plants in Moscow, Tver regions, Russia says
item.description: Ukraine launched drone attacks on power and refinery plants in Moscow and Tver, sparking fires. Russia claimed its air defense units destroyed 158 drones overnight, with no casualties reported. This escalation comes as Ukraine seeks permission from the US to use allied-supplied weapons for deeper strikes inside Russia, aiming to disrupt Moscow’s war capabilities.

item.title: Florida teacher arrested for alleged abuse of autistic child at Forest Lake Elementary
item.description: A teacher in Volusia County with 36 years of experience faces a felony charge of child abuse after allegedly restraining a 3-year-old autistic student in a headlock. A paraeducator reported the incident, and the child showed physical distress. The teacher, Vilma Otero, is currently on administrative leave while the school district investigates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
